millsfield:images_texts:
PSA
PACIFIC SOUTHWEST AIRLINES
ELECTRA
You are flying aboard an Electra, with a captain and crew who are thoroughly trained
and experienced. There is little likelihood we will encounter a situation requiring
emergency preparations but it is a good practice to be acquainted with the safety
features provided for you on this airplane. Follow the instructions of the flight crew.
NO SMOKING
When the
"NO SMOKING" sign is off,
you may smoke while seated in the
smoking section of the cabin. Whenever
the
"NO SMOKING"
sign comes on,
however, all smoking material is to be
extinguished.
EMERGENCY EXITS
COCKPIT
SEAT BELTS
Move around as much as you like in the
cabin while the seat belt sign is off. We
suggest, however, that you keep your seat
belt fastened while in your seats. Of
course, seat belts must be fastened any
time the seat belt sign is on.
WINDOW EXIT
MAIN
(Some Aircraft)
CABIN
DOOR
(Stairs)
LIFT TO
RELEASE-
WINDOW
EXIT
WINDOW
EXIT
AT 8-10 10/75
SEAT BACKS
During taxiing, takeoff and landing, each
SERVICE
DOOR
(Slide)
seatback in the aircraft must be in the up-
right position.
FLOTATION SEAT CUSHION
LOUNGE
DOOR
(Slide)
The cushion on which you are sitting is
designed to keep you afloat. In the event
of a water landing, grasp the cushion at
the rear, pull it forward and take it with you.
IF AN EMERGENCY LANDING SHOULD BE NECESSARY, OBSERVE THE FOLLOWING:
• Loosen necktie and collar, remove spectacles and false teeth, and sharp articles from
pockets.
• Adjust seat to full upright position and fasten seat belt securely.
• Upon command "Brace" given by Stewardess, assume appropriate position.
BRACE POSITIONS
FORWARD FACING
AFT AND SIDE
SEATS
FACING SEATS
EVACUATION
If evacuation is ordered
after the landing, leave
through the window or door
exits shown on this chart.
Assemble with other pass-
engers at the designated
point, well clear of the air-
plane.
2-3-11/75 Supersedes PSA17D

properties.sfomuseum:description: Safety information card issued by Pacific Southwest Airlines (PSA) for the Lockheed L-188 Electra fleet; yellow double-sided card with illustrations demonstrating inflight safety and emergency procedures; information code 2-3--11/75 supersedes PSA 17D.
properties.wof:name: safety information card: Pacific Southwest Airlines (PSA), Lockheed L-188 Electra
